meanings.definition: To add a proton to (a molecule)
meanings.sent1: She protonated the molecule by adding a proton to it.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often protonate molecules to study their properties.
meanings.sent3: The molecule felt special after being protonated by the scientist.
meanings.sent4: Adding a proton to the molecule was like giving it a new identity.
meanings.sent5: The process of protonating the molecule was fascinating to observe.

meanings.sent1: The protonated molecule showed unique properties under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The chemist identified the protonated compound in the solution.
meanings.sent3: The protonated molecule was the life of the party, attracting other particles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a protonated atom in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent5: The protonated solution glowed like a star in the dark laboratory.
